item.title: Data Scientist
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team

 

The Data Strategy & Enablement team is on a continuous journey towards helping TELUS become a world-class leader in data solutions, doing so by delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI solutions, high-quality data, and a data-product-oriented culture while always keeping an eye on the horizon, preparing for the next big thing.

 

We are entrepreneurial and live by our AI Manifesto of failing fast and being outcome vs technology-driven, creating value for our customers, team members, communities, and the environment. The team takes pride in our Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning capabilities and takes ownership of each step of the process. From hypothesis generation, initial exploring of datasets, developing novel AI techniques to discover insights, to developing automation pipelines and web visualizations, we do it all!

 

Always wanted to work with a team of innovators touching all business units within TELUS, and be part of a culture that embraces creativity and collaboration? If so, we’d love to talk with you!

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

You’ll be a part of the team and journey that will transform the way we do business across various domains. You’ll collaborate with teams across the company, seeking out various data sources to help identify new business opportunities while championing data-driven decision-making and the accelerated adoption of AI.

 

As a Data Scientist on the team, you will combine your expert knowledge of data science with your strong software development skills to automate and facilitate data exploration, analytics, machine learning model development, training and deployment and will leverage your experience in building reusable algorithms, functions and libraries.

 

Here\'s how

 

  • Lead the iterative development, validation, and deployment of AI/ML models
  • Collaborate on end-to-end automation efforts required to bring models to production
  • Work with structured and unstructured raw data to design and develop innovative predictive models, metrics, and dashboards to uncover actionable insights
  • Visualize and report data findings creatively in a variety of visual formats that provide insights to the organization
  • Influence how we approach business challenges and opportunities by driving the adoption of a data-driven mindset
  • Develop re-usable code aimed at delivering on future goals faster and more reliably
  • Support and evolve the Advanced Analytics and Data Science roadmap by leveraging industry research, best practices and emerging tools/technology
  • Build and maintain a strong engagement with key stakeholders to understand business needs and priorities

 

 

Qualifications

 

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • You are recognized for addressing business needs via your application of data mining and analysis, predictive modeling, statistics and other advanced analytical techniques in which you have previous hands-on work experience
  • You are sought out for your skills in Machine Learning and AI, including regression, classification, clustering, time series analysis, NLP, and optimization and bring 2-4 years of hands-on work and practical business experience in the above areas
  • You are a master communicator capable of breaking down technical and complex concepts in a way that is understood by non-technical audiences
  • You have solid development experience with Python and you are comfortable using various data science libraries such as Scikit-learn, Pandas, Numpy as well as frameworks like TensorFlow, Pytorch, Keras and have applied these skills towards solving actual business matters
  • You are comfortable in and with a Jupyter environment and infrastructure, and familiar with GitHub
  • You possess advanced knowledge in SQL and distributed computing
  • You are familiar with at least one of the cloud computing platforms - GCP, AWS, Azure
  • You are well versed in software and AI development lifecycles, including ML Ops
  • You are agile and have a bias for action, removing roadblocks to get results fast

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Masters or PhD degree in a quantitative field such as Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Engineering, or Data Science
  • Experience with agile methodology and work in a start-up environment
  • GCP or other cloud certifications

item.title: Senior Machine Learning Engineering Consultant
item.description:
Description

 

Our team and what we’ll accomplish together

As a ML Engineer at TELUS, you’ll be in great company, working alongside some of the brightest and most creative Data Scientists, Data Engineers, and Strategists. You will be part of the journey we’re on to better understand our customers, to predict their needs and interaction behavior. With your expert knowledge and experience in Machine Learning, you will contribute to the development of state-of-the-art ML & AI driven solutions. Our team works in a fun, innovative, and challenging environment that directly influences the strategic direction and performance of the Marketing, Strategy & Data Insights team in our Home Solutions and Mobility business.

 

  • We provide opportunities for you to excel and show your stuff: work on high-value and high-visibility projects
  • We have flexible work styles with the ability to work in and out of the office
  • You will work in a team that actively supports your personal development with progressive training and development tools


What you’ll do

 

  • Support and evolve the AI Insights roadmap by leveraging industry research, best practices, and emerging tools/technologies
  • Study and transform data science prototypes and design machine learning systems according to requirements for production
  • Select appropriate datasets and data representation methods
  • Execute, oversee, and evolve production ML models and algorithm selection to deliver solutions that are relevant and facilitate decision-making.
  • Build and maintain a strong engagement with key stakeholders to understand business needs and priorities
  • Identify opportunities for process/model optimization and refine to improve effectiveness/accuracy and enhance ROI 
  • Collaborate with Data Scientists and Data Engineers within TELUS as well as external Data Science communities
  • Responsible for end-to-end engagement from problem definition to insight delivery as well as value realization & measurement

 

 

Qualifications

 

What you bring

 

  • You have 5 + years experience in a data related position
  • Extensive experience with ML frameworks, platforms and tools, and expert knowledge with GCP
  • You have solid development experience with Python and are comfortable with using GitHub and other programing languages
  • You are well versed in software and AI development lifecycles
  • You are capable of delivering technical and complex concepts in a way that is understood by non-technical audiences
  • You are a collaborative, creative, open-minded individual who possesses a natural curiosity and desire to experiment
  • You have the ability to communicate effectively to gather advanced Data Science requirements from Director-level stakeholders and communicate finding/insights in clear concise manner; ability to create/deliver impactful presentations


Great-to-haves

 

  • Masters in a quantitative field such as Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or Data Science
  • Google Professional ML Engineering Certification
  • Data visualization experience: Data Studio, Tableau, PowerBI, Domo, or Looker
  • Experience with agile methodology and team-based software development workflows (e.g. JIRA, Monday.com, etc.) #LI-Remote

item.title: Data Engineer
item.description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

 

Are you obsessed with data and identifying ways to harness and scale data intelligence across an entire organization? Do you love collaborating with fellow data professionals to develop innovative data solutions that lead to positive business outcomes? If your answer is yes, we would be delighted to have you onboard TELUS’ Data Strategy & Enablement team to provide vision and strategic guidance, while driving flawless execution on the development and evolution of large-scale machine learning environments.

 

You’ll be part of a multidisciplinary team of data wizards who are capitalizing on analytics and insights to deliver exceptional products and services for our customers. In turn, we hope you’ll enjoy being a valued member of Canada’s #1 global workplace with a world-leading culture featuring extensive community-giving initiatives, flexible work environment including remote work, award-winning opportunities for career development, and a competitive compensation and benefits package.

 

As a technology company, data is central to our mission to create better outcomes for our customers, especially as we strive to deliver next generation networks like 5G; unlock the full potential of the Internet of Everything to power smart homes, businesses, industry, healthcare and cities; and deliver an incredible customer experience. Our Data Strategy & Enablement team is at the helm of building world-class data solutions by delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced Augmented Intelligence (AI) tooling, high quality data, and a data product and platform-oriented culture. At the same time, this team remains passionate champions of reliability, security and privacy by design, and is committed to creating the utmost level of privacy and security protections for all data on our networks and systems. You’ll provide vision and strategic guidance to evolve from common static analysis to dynamic machine learning deployments, as well as expand our teams’ access to deep insights that improve the customer experience. You’ll work with a talented team of Data Scientists and other professionals to manage TELUS’ data
 

What you’ll do

  • Build and maintain scalable data infrastructure that offers a best-in-class experience for internal stakeholders including consistent extraction of value from the data
  • Drive data ingestion and processing in innovative ways that inform strategic priorities and decision-making across the organization
  • Foster continuous systems transformation as we migrate infrastructure and applications to Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
  • Build expertise in the team to expose efficiency insights across data platforms in the cloud
  • Manage our cloud data analytics platform priorities to make sure data security and privacy are top considerations
  • Implement automation and monitoring tools through a test-driven approach and mindset
  • Drive the adoption of new cloud technologies to further advance TELUS’ data transformation strategy

Qualifications

What you bring   

  • An expert understanding of data warehouses/cloud architectures and ETL processes
  • Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases and query authoring (SQL), as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases
  • Experience with cloud platforms: GCP, Amazon or Azure (GCP gives you an edge!)
  • Experience with Python and software engineering best practices
  • Advanced knowledge in Dataflow, Spark and Kafka, as well as other data pipeline components
  • Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools such as Airflow
  • Experience with Github and CICD processes
  • 3+ years of progressive and relevant work experience
  • Having a proven track record in leading data analytics platform projects
  • Ready to work in new and challenging work environments
  • Getting excited by the opportunity to build a team\'s capabilities to create value and innovate through data, and doing so in an agile manner with a bias for action and speed
  • Envisioning and delivering future technical roadmaps while inspiring others along the way
  • Being a senior strategist and mentor who is sought out when it comes to analyzing and translating technicalities into business implications
  • Working in cross-functional teams with exemplary communication and coordination skills
  • Proving your analytical skills with root cause analysis of issues
  • Demonstrating resilience, a questioning mindset, and strong observation skills and curiosity – you never settle for the status quo!
  • Caring passionately about your stakeholders and providing them with the data and insights they need to deliver on their customer and business outcomes

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Post graduate education in Data Engineering, Cloud DevOps or Advanced Analytics
  • Machine learning and data science knowledge
  • Experience with Java in Cloud

item.title: Senior Data Engineer
item.description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

 

Are you obsessed with data and identifying ways to harness and scale data intelligence across an entire organization? Do you love collaborating with fellow data professionals to develop innovative data solutions that lead to positive business outcomes? If your answer is yes, we would be delighted to have you onboard TELUS’ Data Strategy & Enablement team to provide vision and strategic guidance, while driving flawless execution on the development and evolution of large-scale machine learning environments.

 

You’ll be part of a multidisciplinary team of data wizards who are capitalizing on analytics and insights to deliver exceptional products and services for our customers. In turn, we hope you’ll enjoy being a valued member of Canada’s #1 global workplace with a world-leading culture featuring extensive community-giving initiatives, flexible work environment including remote work, award-winning opportunities for career development, and a competitive compensation and benefits package.

 

As a technology company, data is central to our mission to create better outcomes for our customers, especially as we strive to deliver next generation networks like 5G; unlock the full potential of the Internet of Everything to power smart homes, businesses, industry, healthcare and cities; and deliver an incredible customer experience. Our Data Strategy & Enablement team is at the helm of building world-class data solutions by delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced Augmented Intelligence (AI) tooling, high quality data, and a data product and platform-oriented culture. You’ll work with a talented team of Data Scientists and other professionals to manage TELUS’ data platforms and offer the best possible analytics experience to internal stakeholders using the data. And finally, as a trusted advisor and partner, you’ll collaborate across various business units to accelerate the transformation of our platforms, improve the customer and team member experience, and drive business efficiencies.

What you bring

  • Ready to work in new and challenging work environments
  • Getting excited by the opportunity to build a team\'s capabilities to create value and innovate through data, and doing so in an agile manner with a bias for action and speed
  • Envisioning and delivering future technical roadmaps while inspiring others along the way
  • Being a senior strategist and mentor who is sought out when it comes to analyzing and translating technicalities into business implications
  • Working in cross-functional teams with exemplary communication and coordination skills
  • Proving your analytical skills with root cause analysis of issues
  • Demonstrating resilience, a questioning mindset, and strong observation skills and curiosity – you never settle for the status quo!

item.title: Manager - Information Services (DevOps)
item.description:
Description

 

Ready to showcase your top-notch DevOp leadership expertise?


Join our team

 

The Capability and Modernization team is a niche team with large scope. We get things done, from system integrations, workflow customization, data science, data aggregation and visualization, reporting, business enablement and special strategic initiatives. We have a finger on the pulse supporting TELUS’ Network Build Operations business units with thousands of team members.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

You’re a strategic thinker with an expert level skill for capturing business insights and applying them to learning and business decision opportunities for TELUS’ Capability and Modernization team. This highly recognized team has a proven track record for building next-generation technology roadmaps and delivering best-in-class solutions. You will partner with peers, senior leaders and stakeholders to drive out transformational business opportunities using our cutting edge technology platforms. Today, you could be helping us further develop and deliver our innovative solutions across TELUS teams.

 

Here’s how

 

  • An in-depth understanding of DevOps practices and experience on maintaining a culture of continuous improvements
  • Display technical leadership on the implementation, deployment, delivery, and the operations of technical solutions managed by the CM team
  • Identify opportunities to strengthen the Capability and Modernization practices such as: sharing expertise to promote technical development, mentoring team members and contractors, building and attending communities of practice and networking with peers
  • Identify and define new process and/or system improvement opportunities
  • Provide specialized consulting, analytical and technical support
  • Works across TELUS IT teams to ensure systems, platform upgrades, network upgrades and security deployments are implemented with minimal impact to production environments
  • Participate in architecture and design review sessions
  • Support revenue generating and cost saving initiatives across business teams - CNP, NBO & CTE 
  • Work with CM SMEs and Development teams in system troubleshooting and performance tuning
  • Provide on-call support of operational issues when necessary
  • Produce documentation related to services, solutions and interfaces
  • Keep informed on technology trends, DevOps, business strategy and continuously develop your own expertise and knowledge
  • Works independently and regularly handles non-routine situations

 

 

Qualifications

 

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • 5 years experience with DevOps delivery
  • 5 years experience leading, coaching, mentoring, and developing technical people and teams
  • A progressive thought leader who can empower and energize high performing people
  • Proven experience managing system changes without interruption to teams and users
  • Working in a collaborative virtual environment, interfacing with other team members regularly, sharing knowledge via diagrams, discussion, and example
  • An ability to drive to big picture goals and milestones while valuing and maintaining a strong attention to detail
  • An ability to quickly identify and drive to the optimal solution when presented with a series of constraints
  • Experience automating workflows
  • Experience with API and system integrations

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Experience working in matrix organizational structures in large enterprise organizations
  • Mulesoft and API integration experience
  • Atlassian and Appian workflow development experience 
  • AI & Machine Learning exposure
  • GSuite
  • Prior experience operationalizing enterprise IT systems including processes, governance, and team resources

item.title: DataOps Engineer
item.description:
We are the TELUS Data Strategy & Enablement team, our mission is to drive TELUS to become a world-class data insights driven organization, delivering world-class data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling, high quality data, and a data-product/data platform oriented culture. Our team members are passionate, dynamic, entrepreneurial and highly engaged, driven to achieve great outcomes for our customers, our team members, our communities and our environment.

 

We believe in continuous meaningful transformation integrating dynamic change in our professional lives. Our team members are always learning, experimenting and applying tuition value into everything we do.

 

Join our team


We are searching for a talented candidate to join our team in the role of DataOps Engineer. Reporting to the Manager – Analytics and Business Intelligence Platforms, the successful candidate will be responsible for designing, implementing, and supporting solutions to enable business product teams to drive value by realizing Analytics and Machine Learning use cases. This role will support our evolving DataOps landscape by providing analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling, improved speed to market and automation.  This role will be an agent of change and support our evolving strategy, data, and analytics roadmaps as well as provide strong direction for our Cloud based Analytics and Business Intelligence platforms.  
 

Here\'s How:

 

  • Collaborating with Business and Product teams to enable valuable Analytics and Machine Learning use cases
  • Designing and implementing DataOps and MLOps processes and automations using the latest tools to effectively operationalize Analytics and AI workflows
  • Staying up to date of new software, tools, and organizations that are having an impact on the Analytics and Machine Learning landscape
  • Provisioning infrastructure and secure, reliable data-centric services and applications in GCP for Data & Analytics users across the TELUS enterprise
  • Identify opportunities to make substantial improvements to the deployment and support of our DataOps environment demonstrating a DevOps mindset while improving our reliability and speed to market
  • Foster internal and external stakeholder relationships, including building highly collaborative relationships with business product teams and technical teams

 


What you bring

 

  • You are passionate about Agile culture and DevOps practices
  • Your have a keen interest in Data Analytics and Machine Learning, and are familiar with the machine learning life cycle
  • Experience with the data offerings in Google Cloud Platform (e.g. BigQuery, Dataproc, Dataflow, Vertex AI)
  • You have experience in implementing CI/CD processes and integrating source code version control (e.g. GitHub) with automated workflows.
  • You have hands on experience in Infrastructure-as-Code (e.g. Terraform, Pulumi) and the Python programming language
  • You are a skilled relationship builder and skilled at prioritization, negotiation and influencing
  • You can communicate clearly and effectively in both technical and business matters, and are able to translate technical considerations into business implications 
  • You can pivot between supporting the urgent needs of the business and working on strategic initiatives
  • You have experience working on and supporting large, complex technical projects that involve multiple stakeholders and business units

 

Great-to-haves:

 

  • Undergrad in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Science or equivalent
  • 3+ years of progressive and relevant work experience with data/analytics platforms, DevOps, and/or machine learning
  • GCP Professional Certification

item.title: Senior Software Developer
item.description:
Description

Join our team 

 

Become part of a future friendly national team, one that embraces change and initiates opportunity, has a passion for growth, believes in spirited teamwork, and has the courage to innovate. Our success is based as much on your dedication and hard work as it is on the innovative television, internet, voice, data and wireless products and solutions we offer. 

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together 

 

As part of our Smart Cities and Home Services team, you will imagine, create, support and test innovative smart cities and live streaming services for TELUS. This is an opportunity for you to develop solutions and designs for streaming video while providing our customers with the best video streaming experiences. We’re stretching the boundaries of what is possible, and supporting and enabling local communities to expand their audiences.

 

Here\'s how

 

  • Provide leadership and architectural support for CI/CD pipeline and software development practices for a small team of developers
  • Create, test, and support new systems and services that you help create, operating in a dev-ops team.
  • Bring familiarity with building and using containers and other cloud-native tools
  • Develop new architectures and technologies to deliver the best viewing experience for our customers.
  • Develop and maintain technical documentation and architecture
  • Apply best practices of software development in different frameworks and troubleshoot integration issues
  • Automate service testing to ensure reliable and repeatable results.
  • Ensure a high level of code quality and integrity in software development projects
  • Work with Project Managers and Network Planners to ensure the successful delivery of projects
  • An understanding of the importance of automation and continuous integration and deployment

Qualifications


What you bring

 

  • 5+ years of software development experience utilizing CI/CD practices and agile methodologies
  • Extensive experience with cloud-native tools and cloud environments (GCP and AWS)
  • Capable of mentoring developers and sharing your knowledge
  • Strong troubleshooting methodology
  • An interest in video streaming technologies
  • Insatiable curiosity for problem solving, technology and innovation
  • Desire to learn and take on new challenges
  • Ability to collaborate with diverse groups and technical teams
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Having a creative approach to problem solving and an ability to work independently in an environment with high levels of ambiguity
  • Ability to manage key deliverables as part of an extended project team
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, talented at developing and fostering positive relationships with other team members
  • Bachelors in Computer Science, Engineering or related discipline

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Python, Java, C#
  • MySQL, MongoDB or equivalent databases
  • Docker, Kubernetes, Istio, Ansible
  • GitHub, AzureDevops, BitBucket, or equivalent source control repositories
  • Github Workflows, ArgoCD, Google CloudBuild, Helm or equivalent CI-CD pipeline tools
  • Adaptive bitrate streaming including HLS, DASH, and CDN technologies
  • Video analytics powered by machine learning technologies

FFHJOBS

item.title: Product Owner, Data Engineering
item.description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

 

The Data Strategy & Enablement team is on a continuous journey towards helping TELUS become a world-class leader in data solutions, doing so by delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling, high quality data, and a data-product and data platform oriented culture while always keeping an eye on the horizon, preparing for the next big thing. We are entrepreneurial and passionate, believers that so much more is possible and can be achieved by creating value and great outcomes for our customers, team members, communities, and environment and that through meaningful transformation we can integrate dynamic change in our professional lives.
 
The Data Strategy and Enablement team has started its journey towards enabling further digital transformation in our data and advanced analytics space. Composed of Data Engineers, Business Systems Analysts and Data Architects our team focuses on building and enabling best-in-class data platforms with a focus on migrating our major on premise data warehouses to Google’s Cloud Platform. Join a dynamic team that is paving the way towards digital transformation and enable teams across the organization to make better use of data. Make use of your analytical skills and ability to analyze and assess the impact of data on upstream and downstream systems and help clarify and define cloud-related business processes and best practices across TELUS. Help architect the transformation and modernization of our enterprise data solutions and the integration of Google Cloud and native GCP services and 3rd party data technologies.
 


What you’ll do

 

  • Lead engagement with various Business Unit (BU) stakeholders across TELUS to understand their business and need for insights.
  • Influence how BU stakeholders approach business challenges and opportunities by driving the adoption of a data driven mindset.
  • Play the critical role of “translator” i.e. translating business problems into data problems and resolving these problems to generate value.
  • Facilitate collaboration between BU stakeholders and our team and lead solutioning including use-case development, defining insight products and their roadmap and end-to-end automation efforts required to bring products to production. Track and prioritize the development of insight products on an ongoing basis and bring visibility to any roadblocks
  • Support development of our team’s strategy, develop/present materials to TELUS executive leadership on an ongoing basis
  • Support in measuring and tracking EBITDA-based value contribution by our team through collaboration with BU stakeholders and Finance
     

Qualifications


What you bring

 

  • You are recognized for addressing business needs via your innovative approach and application of AI and other advanced analytical techniques
  • You are sought out for your skills in strategy development, problem-solving, structured thinking, advanced communication (both verbal and written), project management and bring 5 or more years of hands-on work and practical business experience in the above areas.
  • You are a master communicator capable of breaking down technical and complex concepts in a way that is understood by non-technical audiences.
  • You are familiar with cloud computing platforms - GCP, AWS, Azure.
  • You are agile and have a bias for action, removing roadblocks to get results fast
  • You are experienced with Subscriber Analysis Application (SAA) from Scorecard Systems for RGU insights
  • You are experienced with Informatica IICS and Powercenter ETL tools
  • You have a strong SQL foundation 


 
Great-to-haves
 

  • You are experienced in the data engineering field and comfortable in leading projects in it.
  • You have GCP or other cloud certification.
  • Scrum Master Certified
  • PMP Certified

item.title: Privacy Engineer (Remote)
item.description:
JOIN OUR TEAM

 

The TELUS Data & Trust Office provides world-class, innovative privacy solutions to TELUS. We partner with teams across the organization to advance our corporate priorities, support innovation and ultimately deliver on our promise to safeguard our customer’s privacy and to earn and maintain their trust.

 

We see compliance with the law as our starting point and we passionately pursue opportunities to demonstrate respect for our customers and their data through transparent, robust, and ethical data practices.

 

Our team takes pride in earning a reputation for being innovative thought-leaders, strategic business partners and subject-matter experts in privacy and data governance.

Description

 

The impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

As the Privacy Engineer, supported by the Director of Privacy & Innovation, you will materially influence the ongoing development of TELUS’ business innovation focused on supporting the growth of the business along with the development, deployment, and use of new digital technologies.  

 

You will collaborate with, advise and guide the business to embed privacy by design principles from the first stages of development to ensure data practices meet our rigorous privacy, security and ethical standards, and in a manner that demonstrates TELUS commitment to putting customers and their privacy first. 

You will be an integral member of the Data & Trust Office.  This team is tasked with solving some of our organization\'s most complex challenges while building a thriving community of practice around data ethics and data governance.

You will be a champion for Privacy & Innovation and you will advocate for TELUS’ Trust Model as the fundamental driver for all of our decisions around data, recognizing how critical customer and team member trust is to TELUS’ mission.

 

 Here’s how:

 

  • Identity opportunities to build or procure privacy-enhancing technologies, including to support the use of de-identification and synthetic data.  

  • Advise on how privacy-enhancing technologies can serve as an enabler for business program operations and assist with their deployment within the organization.

  • Architect solutions to enable algorithmic fairness and explainability, data quality monitoring, and the development and implementation of data validation and testing strategies.

  • Support the development of a data analytics program to deploy or leverage technology responsibly and ethically always in a manner that demonstrates TELUS’ commitment to putting customers and their privacy first.  

  • Develop the design and documentation of processes that standardize best practices in privacy engineering and support an agile development methodology.

  • Educate and advise business units on existing or new data uses, and provide innovative strategies and creative solutions to address privacy, compliance and data governance considerations.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to ensure adherence to the TELUS’ Trust Model.

Qualifications

 

You are the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • Demonstrated track record of providing subject matter expertise in embedded privacy by design into product and services while delivering on measurable outcomes for our customers and our businesses in a highly complex stakeholder environment. 

  • Familiarity with privacy-enhancing technologies (e.g. differential privacy, federated learning, synthetic data, etc.) and demonstrated working knowledge or understanding of software engineering fundamentals and lifecycle development.

  • Familiarity with statistics, algorithms, and machine learning tools to analyze and evaluate fair and ethical AI.

  • Passionate about privacy, data ethics and the imperative to use data to solve big and small problems.

  • Keen to explore new and creative solutions to change the trajectory of persistent challenges and motivated to bring those solutions to life.

  • Appreciated for your excellent interpersonal and problem solving skills, and your ability to distill complex and/or ambiguous problems into clear, actionable requirements.

  • Known for your ability to influence and negotiate effectively, to be a persuasive advocate, and known for your conflict resolution skills with a focus on win-win solutions.

  • Sought out for excellent communication skills, verbal & written, with the ability to present information at all levels of the organization and leadership forums.

  • 3-5 years experience in privacy / data protection or a graduate degree or concentration in privacy engineering.

  • Post-secondary degree in computer science, computer engineering, information systems, privacy engineering, or related field of study.

  • Certification in Privacy (e.g., CDPSE, CIPT, CIPM, CIPP certification).

Great-to-haves

 

  • Experience is proactively embedding privacy considerations into product design.  

  • Experience with the development, design, and architecture of IT technology, data management, and data integration processes.

  • Experience with design for software applications running on multiple platforms.

  • Experience with web architecture and the privacy and security model of the web.

  • Bilingual in French & English, verbal and/or written.

item.title: Manager, Data Engineering
item.description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

 

We are searching for a talented candidate to become our team’s Manager, Enterprise Data Engineering. Reporting to the Director – Enterprise Data Engineering, the successful candidate will be responsible for leading a team of accomplished data analysts, engineers and architects supporting our data and analytics platform transformation. This role will be an agent of change and support the evolving strategy, data and analytics roadmaps as well as provide overarching direction to support our TELUS Business Solutions Team (TBS).

 

The portfolio will focuses on continuous improvement to our GCP engineering practices (common ingestion framework), CI/CD pipelines, DevOps, SRE, real-time data ingestion, addressing technical debt and support the Business Master Data Management (MDM) and Revenue Generating Unit (RGU) workstreams. Our team is a cloud first team and leverages the latest technologies to fuel our mission and purpose.

 

What you’ll do

 

 At TELUS, we put ‘Customers First’. With a broad set of responsibilities and a high degree of visibility across the TELUS organization, the successful candidate will have the opportunity to:

 

  • Lead a team of talented data platform Analysts, Engineers and Architects to drive the modernization of our data platforms
  • Foster internal and external stakeholder relationships, including managing senior executive participants
  • Provide guidance to establish standards and best practices for building enterprise grade data pipelines
  • Work with our preferred Cloud service providers to align our roadmap based on their release schedule for services and product offerings.
  • Construct comprehensive business cases and financial models leveraging various methods to support strategic projects and decisions with data driven insights
  • Utilize internal and external data points coupled with market research on marketplace dynamics impacting TELUS and the Data Strategy team to inform opportunities and risks for the team
  • Create technology roadmaps for business partners, executive management, and external audiences to enhance strategic decision making and support technology investment recommendations
  • Collaborate with key stakeholders to create, track and evolve the team scorecards and strategic imperatives
  • Support the annual strategic and financial planning process
  • Flex your communication, negotiation, and influencing skills, working with a broad set of internal stakeholders, executives and external partners
  • Mentor, lead, and support a diverse and very talented team

Qualifications


What you bring

 

You have experience in technical leadership, managing data platforms, business intelligence tools and setting architectural direction

  • You can communicate clearly and effectively in both technical and business matters able to translate technical considerations into business implications
  • You are analytical and outcome-oriented with a proven ability to translate business requirements into high-level design models
  • You have hands on knowledge of foundational cloud data architecture of lakes, warehouses, data modeling, and life cycle management
  • You have demonstrated experience with the governance and oversight of data privacy, security and the ethical use of data in previous roles
  • You have experience with cloud migration projects, agile methodologies, and DevOps practices
  • You have impressive people leadership track record with proven ability to recruit, coach, mentor and lead high performing teams in a fast-paced environment
  • You are a skilled relationship builder and skilled at prioritization, negotiation and influencing
  • You can pivot between supporting the urgent needs of the business and the long-term roadmap
  • You have experience working on and supporting large, complex technical projects that involve multiple stakeholders and business units
  • You have exposure to tools, technologies and programming languages including, but not limited to, Python, Airflow (composer), SQL, Apache Nifi, Hive, Spark, Dataflow (Apache Beam) and Kafka
  • You have experience creating a vision for and implementing a culture of change to drive CI/CD, DevOps and other opportunities for operational effectivenes

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Bachelor of Computer Science or equivalent
  • 5+ years of progressive and relevant work experience with enterprise data
  • PMP certification is an asset
  • Experience with the data offerings in the Google Cloud Platform
  • Experience in the telecommunications industry
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to lead a large team

item.title: API & Data Management Developer
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team

 

The Data Strategy & Enablement team is on a continuous journey towards helping TELUS become a world-class leader in data solutions. We are doing so by delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling and high quality data. We have a data-product and data platform oriented culture and we are always keeping an eye on the horizon, preparing for the next big thing.

 

We are entrepreneurial and passionate, believers that so much more is possible and can be achieved by creating value and great outcomes for our customers, team members, communities, and environment and that through meaningful transformation we can integrate dynamic change in our professional lives.

 

Our team members appreciate diversity of thinking, ideas and experiences, and are always learning, experimenting and applying tuition value into everything we do.

 

The impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

As an API & Data Management Developer in the Metadata Management Program, you’ll contribute to the design, development and support of a variety of integration and process automation techniques to ensure accurate ingestion of technical metadata from many source systems. You will design and develop APIs to enable programmatic consumption of metadata by consumers external to the metadata management platform. In addition you will ensure reliable and consistent processing to our Collibra cloud platform and automate information lifecycle management processes using web enabled workflows.

 

As a trusted technical expert, you will collaborate with various business units and demonstrate thought leadership when sitting at the intersection between privacy, ethics, technology, data and consumers to ensure it is leveraged in a respectful manner while continuing to advance our reputation of being trustworthy through transparent communication.

Here’s How

 

  • Work with business stakeholders on the adoption and onboarding of the TELUS Metadata Management Tool powered by Collibra (training and technical support)
  • Collaborate with business stakeholders to define integration approaches, identify the best techniques, ensure capture and storage of all available metadata, ensure durable API processing is available to subscription customers
  • Support and maintain the API enablement of the TELUS Metadata Management Tool powered by Collibra through the entire lifecycle from design to deployment within the TELUS cloud environment
  • Work with the supporting teams, organizations and vendors to provide updates to existing deployed technologies and collect information from production systems for analysis
  • Define, enable, test and automate scripts for integration and process automation activities including documentation, work products and team presentations as well
  • Develop test strategies and site reliability engineering measures for data products and solutions
  • Participate in agile development scrums and solutions reviews
  • Lead resolution of critical operations issues including post-implementation reviews
  • Contribute to the strategic direction and evolution of TELUS Enterprise Metadata & Data Quality Management application

 

 

Qualifications

 

You are the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • You are sought out for your strong understanding of Metadata Management, Data Quality, Data Lineage and Data Management
  • You are respected for your knowledge of Solution Development and Data Management Lifecycles
  • You are recognized for your understanding of integration patterns including RESTful architecture and patterns, APIs and event based processing
  • You are hands on in Windows Operating Systems, Unix, Linux, JSOn, Yaml, Swagger and with GCP Kubernetes (GKE), GCP Development and deployment using a CI/CD pipeline including Git, terraform, cloud build and deploy
  • You are commended for your expertise with Collibra - including managing system activities, tenant administration, user groups creation etc
  • You are recognized for your understanding of and experience with programming in JAVA especially Springboot or equivalent, with Collibra and Collibra APIs or GCP SDK experience
  • You are recognized for your understanding of and experience with Oracle, SQL server, GCP BigQuery,PostgreSQL,and NoSQL
  • You are an expert communicator and strategic thinker, able to provide a consultative approach in alignment with the Telco Management Industry Framework
  • You are an excellent and effective presenter able to communicate ideas in a clear and concise manner
  • You are an effective influencer and negotiator, able to be persuasive while upholding commitments to our customers, stakeholders and TELUS’ commitment to integrity
  • Fluency in speaking, reading and writing in English
  • 4+ years Data Engineering experience / 2 year data solution architecture and design

 

Great-to-Haves

 

  • University degree in computer science and/or 5 years of working experience in Information Management
  • Demonstrable DAMA international BOK Framework knowledge and/or application
  • Demonstrated TM Forum Frameworxs knowledge
  • Fluency in speaking, reading and writing in French

item.title: Manager - Business & Performance Analysis
item.description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together


The Performance Analysis team within Resource Strategy & Analytics is known within TELUS as the
trusted source for providing operational insights for global call center performance.  We present results
and insights to the leadership team every week. We have a fast-paced, high performance culture, with a
tight-knit, collaborative team that likes to have fun while putting our Customers First!

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

As the Manager of Performance Analysis you will use your strong leadership and coaching skills to lead a team of Performance Analysts, Business Analysts, and a Cloud Architect.


You will work closely with the Customer Experience Enablement and Customer Experience Strategy development teams to deliver on our strategic objectives; our key stakeholders and partners include

 

Here’s How

 

  • Help propel our business forward by creating meaningful understanding of business drivers,
  • issues, and opportunities while enjoying a high degree of autonomy   
  • Take the initiative to constantly and consistently apply your analytical and relationship skills to
  • support stakeholders
  • Support data-driven decision-making by enabling actionable insights from disparate data sources and implementing key innovation opportunities for stakeholders
  • Implement best-in-class end-to-end analytical processes to drive operational efficiencies and
  • improved decision-making
  • Have the opportunity to showcase your ability to transform data into true business insight
  • Mentor, coach and provide expert technical guidance to develop team members 

Qualifications

 

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • Advanced background in SQL, R and/or Python
  • Competency in BI Tools (Power BI, Domo, Looker, Tableau)
  • Proven ability to breakdown and simplify complex, ambiguous problems
  • Understanding of telecom business models, measures and metrics
  • Embodies ownership, initiative and is self-directed; able to effectively manage ambiguity and change
  • Able to effectively manage stakeholders building relationships to establish cross functional alignment for projects and initiatives
  • Well versed in stakeholder communication, storytelling, and presenting to diverse audiences while tailoring your message
  • Fundamental understanding of Data Science techniques and its strategic impact to business
