We are shipping more and more robots and are taking on bigger and better contracts. We are delivering more and more integrated solutions, including operational and support services through Managed Services approaches. We need someone to help our existing project management team to take our Managed Services projects from original concept through to final implementation, and subsequently ongoing operations and maintenance support to achieve customer operational performance guarantees.

As a Project Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing and coordinating project deliverables and serving as the point of contact between customers, subcontractors and internal departments. Your goal is to manage the efforts of team members and vendors to ensure our projects are delivered on time and ensuring our customers’ needs are met at go live and throughout the operational use of or solutions.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Responsible for identifying project scope, assign individual responsibilities, identify resources needed, and develop a schedule to ensure timely completion of project and delivery.
  • Lead, organize, manage and motivate the project team and develop effective relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
  • Act as the primary interface with Customer project as well as operations management; build close cooperative relationships with Customers, focused on long term partnerships.
  • Manage subcontractors and vendors to ensure on time delivery in line with agreed scope of work within agreed budget.
  • Ensure management of the operational steady state phase of our solutions at our Customer to ensure our customers business objectives and service levels are achieved, including management of operational escalations.
  • Develop detailed work plans, schedules, project estimates, resource plans, and status reports.
  • Conduct project meetings and take responsibility for project tracking and analysis.
  • Responsible for and manage cost, cashflow, schedule, scope and risk management. Responsible for overall profit of project as well as customer satisfaction.
  • Act as the point person for changes, updates, questions, and issues. Identify and pursue opportunities
  • Identify and communicate vital information to the design team and the company
  • Shape and impact processes; 
  • Think ahead to raise and examine problems and propose possible solutions

 About You

You want to work for a small company that thinks big and dreams huge.  You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done.  You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work.  You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.  Oh, and you have some form of higher education with the common sense to back it up.

As our next Senior Project Manager, you know how to under promise and over deliver, adapt to changing directions, priorities and personalities, and be a world-class juggler… with projects and deadlines that is.  You have exceptional project and contract management experience from previous work placements. You have the experience and ability to manage to ensure our solutions, once delivered, are operating and being maintained in a way that ensures business continuity and performance of customer mission critical automated processes.

Required Experience/Skills:

  • BS or MSc Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or similar technical field  in an Engineering discipline. Additional education in business administration, finance, operations, or project management an asset.
  • 10+ years of project management experience in a dynamic environment with multi-disciplined technical team members, demonstrating increasing levels of project value and complexity in automated material handling industry
  • Experience managing complex groups of stakeholders, including large customer organizations as well as subcontractors and vendors. 
  • Leadership capability to create and manage a unified and motivated project team
  • Unusually strong organizational and time-management skills with the ability to handle multiple tasks at once, while still paying attention to detail
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Project and other project management tools
  • A strong work ethic and self-starter attitude, with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
  • Excellent verbal and written communication, with the ability to build long term relationships/partnerships
  • Drive for continuous improvement

Bonus Points For:

  • Mechatronics background and experience with Automated Controls Systems. 
  • Optional: Engineering Technologist degree.
  • Experience within field of automated material handling. 
  • Experience in managing operations and maintenance of mission critical manufacturing or material handling environments with mechanical, electrical, software and IT components.
  • PMP certification/accreditation
  • Experience with RaaS, BPO or managed services type of contracts.
  • Proficiency in Epicor
  • 1-2 years of engineering design experience
  • knowledge of contract law, along with negotiation skills
  • Willing and able to travel internationally (especially US).

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Systems Integrator
item.description:
Description

Position:             Systems Integrator    
Location:             Kitchener, ON     
Job Type:            Full-Time Permanent
Experience:        2-5 years of relevant work experience
Education:          Electrical/Mechanical/Industrial Controls/Mechatronics/Systems Engineering related field
Division:              OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The Systems Engineering (SE) team works closely with our Project Management Office (PMO) within our professional services organization to deliver business value to our end users, channel partners, and for OTTO Motors.  SEs design and implement fleets of OTTO autonomous mobile robots (AMR) and software at our customer facilities. In addition, the SE team delivers training to our integration partners and end-users, and evaluates use cases to establish guidelines, standards, and best practices for how OTTO Motors products can be used by the market, specifically by our integrator network. Furthermore, the SE team is a major contributor to defining our product requirements and is a major influencer of our product roadmap.

Primary responsibilities:

  • detailed design of AMR systems using OTTO Motors products to meet the customer requirements; this includes workflow design, attachment design, map design and development/modification middle layer software logic using Ignition OPC/UA and/or PLC logic design and modification
  • authoring & executing acceptance test plans for validation of system functionality and performance;
  • commissioning & integration of AMR systems at client facilities throughout the world; this includes traveling to customer or integration partner facility for on-site deployment and integration with facility side automation equipment
  • optimizing system performance through analysis, simulation, and experimentation;
  • project planning for the deliverables and work packages you own;
  • communicating technical details and status to the customer and broader project team;
  • consulting with integration partners on all of the above
  • delivery of training to integration partners as well as end users
  • troubleshooting software & hardware technical issues using internal tools available; solving new and challenging technical problems related to the above

Additional responsibilities:

  • authoring new product requirements based on the lessons learned from your design and commissioning activities;
  • working with the systems engineering team to improve department tools, processes, and working relationships with other departments;
  • ability to travel for business within North America, Europe and Asia; ~35 - 45 % travel commitment over the year (travel mostly contained to Canada and USA).  Trips to site would typically be 2 weeks on - 2 weeks off during the project integration phase.

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people who are creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.  You have a customer-first mentality and strive to exceed customer expectations.

Your mastery comes from years of experience in designing and integrating complex systems solutions for industrial automation applications. You are able to represent a complex system via a simplified block diagram representation to convey the objective and details to the end-user systematically.

Required background:

  • 3+ years of relevant work experience
  • 3+ years of experience commissioning & integrating industrial automated equipment or software that interfaces to the equipment
  • college/university diploma or degree in an engineering, design, or industrial controls type of field
  • experience working directly with clients/end-users
  • experience in troubleshooting and repairing electro-mechanical systems/subsystems
  • interpretation & design analysis of mechanical drawings and electrical schematics
  • PLC design and integration experience
  • demonstrated ability to work with Linux
  • planning and organization (how to approach and solve a problem, work breakdown to achieve the end goal, etc.)
  • strong communicator, verbal and written
  • self-motivated and organized with a keen eye for detail

Bonus for experience:

  • training users of automated equipment/software
  • authoring and modifying software code (python, C++, or other)
  • experience with inductive Automation Ignition OPC/UA software
  • Have Spanish as first, second or third language.

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Technical Support Specialist (Rotating Shifts)
item.description:
Description

Position:      Technical Support Specialist
Location:     Kitchener
Job  Type:    Full-Time Permanent
Experience: 3+ years customer-facing work experience
Education:   Bachelors in related field
Division:      OTTO Motors 

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

Clearpath is seeking a Technical Support Specialist to join our highly skilled team in Kitchener. At
Clearpath we believe that every client is a VIP and we need someone who will obsessively focus on
making our customers successful. You will be responsible for providing remote post-sales customer service and technical support to our rapidly growing list of customers globally.  Don’t worry if you encounter a complex technical challenge, we have a team of insanely smart robotics engineers (the brain surgeons of robotics!) who will help you troubleshoot.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Advanced Level technical support to our customers
  • On-call Escalation Support
  • Organizing warranty parts and repairs
  • Triage and customer assistance
  • Escalating tickets and coordinating engineering teams with support efforts
  • On-boarding new customers
  • Acting as a customer advocate internally
  • Chasing down a solution internally to a deployed customers issue
  • Supporting our partners deploying systems at new customer sites

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge.  You are driven, view
work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done.  You want to be
surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are
motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding
problems.   Oh, and you have some form of higher education with the common sense to back it up.

 5+ years customer-facing work experience
 Strong communicator (written and verbal), with excellent phone and email manners

 Well organized and responsive, with great problem solving and negotiation skills
 Passionate about making people happy through exceptional service

Technical Skills:

item.title: Account Executive
item.description:
Description

Position at Clearpath Robotics

Position:             Account Executive
Location:             Waterloo, Ontario              
Experience:        3+ years\' experience
Division:              Clearpath Robotics Research Solutions

About Clearpath Robotics 

Clearpath Robotics is a global leader in unmanned vehicle robotics for research and development, and provides hardware, software, and services to enable self-driving vehicle development, deployment, and operation. Clearpath Robotics works with over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands in over 40 countries, serving markets that span mining, military, agriculture, aerospace, and academia. Visit Clearpath Robotics at www.clearpathrobotics.com.

About the Job 

Clearpath Robotics’ Research Systems team is looking for a well organized, relationship-oriented Account Engineer with proven skills across all account functions: business development, direct technical sales, and account management.

As our newest Account Executive, your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Review client projects and applications, and assist in the scoping & configuration of application-appropriate robotic solutions for customers, independently and in collaboration with our team of Engineers 
  • Gains customer acceptance by explaining or demonstrating product features and software
  • Submits orders by conferring with technical support staff and costing engineering changes.
  • Provide company, product, and technical overview presentations
  • Provide pre-sales quotes to customers in a timely manner
  • Check purchase orders for accuracy against the quote or standards before processing Provide technical assistance to the customers - answering technical queries and perform research when answers are not immediately available
  • Successfully promote and sell Clearpath as a full-service robotic solutions provider
  • Maintain and develop a high level of knowledge of new technology and the company’s solution offerings
  • Contributes to sales engineering effectiveness by identifying short-term and long-range issues that must be addressed, 

About You

Our next Account Executive is a sharp, articulate and collaborative person, who is 100% comfortable spending their days talking to everyone from grad students to CEOs to rocket scientists. You dream of being part of a close-knit sales team that attacks new challenges with a bear hug and thrives equally on collaboration and friendly competition.

You have an innate drive to be successful, and you bring both the acumen and the grit to achieve your objectives.

Our ideal candidate is someone who is described by friends as:

  • Entrepreneurial and resourceful
  • A confident and articulate speaker with the ability to think on their feet
  • Excellent written communication skills
  • Able to understand and communicate technical concepts
  • Exceptional organization and attention to detail
  • Dynamic, dependable and diligent
  • Highly motivated and self-starting
  • Passion for helping customers solve complex problems with innovative technology

Required Skills and Experience:

  • 3 years’ experience of proven excellence in business development, inside sales and/or sales
  • Technical degree or equivalent experience
  • Ability to translate technology features into business benefits
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Strong initiative and ability to work in a self-directed environment
  • Organization and priority setting skills and ability to multi-task in a dynamic environment

Clearpath is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, sex, gender identity and expression, veteran status or sexual orientation. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Sales Applications Engineer (Remote/Virtual - USA/Canada)
item.description:
Description

Position:            Applications Engineer
Location:            Remote/Virtual (USA/Canada)
Job Type:           Full-Time Permanent
Experience:        2-5 years
Education:          Bachelor\'s degree in engineering or a related field
Division:            OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

You will work as a member of the OTTO Motors’ sales organization in an applications technical role as a partner to our account executives. You will be accountable for understanding customer requirements, selecting the best products, and devising solutions that ultimately improve our customer’s business and that meet or exceed the application requirements. You will also consult with channel partners and internal deployment teams to devise deployment plans that achieve the best time-to-value for the end users.  

You will be constantly interacting with customers, learning new technology, developing new system concepts, creating the foundation for successful projects, and impressing clients via virtual and in-person demonstrations of how their business can improve using our products. 

This role requires an awareness and proficiency with systems engineering, industrial engineering, project planning, and it involves interacting with many elements of our business.  

Responsibilities:

  • Be a pre-sales product knowledge expert, technical consultant, and content creator throughout the sales cycle.  Acquired understanding of Otto vehicle deployment methods including software functionality, safety limits, and hardware specifications.
  • Collect and review project information in order to adequately evaluate the customer’s application
  • Create and propose technical solutions for the customer’s application that includes the effective use of OTTO AMR’s, the definition of third-party vehicle attachments, and integration to the customers material handling infrastructure. 
  • Effectively document, present, and explain the proposed OTTO solution to the customer and their Engineering, Production, and Executive team members
  • Enable deployment teams by supplying solution concepts, project risks, and preliminary project plans
  • Be a trusted technical resource for customers and partners throughout the pre-sales process
  • Collect and communicate market data and ideas to our product management organization to improve the market success of our existing and future products
  • Contribute to department improvement initiatives to enhance the team’s efficiency and the value of its contributions to the business

Common Tasks:

  • Review customer RFQ/RFP type documents
  • Collaborate with the Sales Account Managers throughout the sales process; including sales calls, strategy, solutioning, and business-case proposals.
  • Visit customer sites to evaluate material handling operations, processes, existing equipment, and floor layout constraints
  • Utilize Excel to review customer data, evaluate fleet size, cycle time analysis
  • Utilize 2D CAD (DraftSight) to evaluate the facility layout, project feasibility and concepting
  • Work with Third-party attachment providers and System Integrators to concept and budget custom material handling solutions that will interface with the Otto standard product line
  • Review proposals and budgets with the Sales Account Managers
  • Prepare and present slide decks of the overall project scope to the Customer
  • Preparing project specific responsibility matrices for Customer and Otto teams
  • Perform product demonstrations at Customer sites
  • Collaborate with Otto’s Project, Product, and Systems Engineering Teams

Required Skills:

  • Engineering Degree or technical background with experience in Manufacturing, Industrial, Process or Mechanical Engineering
  • Strong understanding of complex integrated systems, material handling, mechanical and industrial equipment and processes. 
  • Experience working directly with sales and customers
  • Proficiency in 2D and 3D CAD software (i.e. AutoCAD, DraftSight, SolidWorks, etc)
  • Able to generate professional and impactful presentations (Powerpoint/Google)
  • Able to effectively communicate and present proposed solutions to customers
  • Able to quickly identify operational challenges and propose mitigation strategies
  • Able to facilitate productive technical discussion both internally and externally
  • Able to identify and communicate the value of OTTO’s proposed solution to the customer

Bonus Points:

  • Experience working with automated vehicles (i.e. AMRs or AGVs)
  • Experience working on projects involving material handling automation, Conveyors, Palletized lines, Automated Storage and Retrieval
  • Experience as a project manager or project engineer
  • Experience with Simulation software (Digital Twin, Event or Process Simulation)

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: AI Backend Developer – 4 Month Co-op/Internship (Winter 2023)-2
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy. At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians.  

Join our team and get ready to explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day. We’ll support your goals with tools, opportunities, and flexibility. It’s our employee promise. 

Our hybrid work model preserves the balance between working from home and enjoying meaningful in-person interaction. The needs for every role are different but on average, you will be together with your colleagues at least once per week, with our leadership team in office three to four days weekly to be present for their teams. 

Ready to make your mark?

About the role

We’re looking for an AI Developer I to join our growing team!

What you\'ll do here:

  • Enhance data usage and deliver AI-based and machine learning solutions.
  • Participate in building and supporting the AI foundations used by the company’s different teams.
  • Evolve AI-based and machine-learning software products.
  • Join a team with high visibility and a multitude of challenges.


What you bring to the table:

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, computer engineering, software engineering, mathematics or any combination of equivalent education and experience
  • 3 years of experience in software development / engineering
  • Excellent understanding of machine learning and artificial intelligence
  • Proficiency with at least one programming language such as Java, C#, C++ or Python
  • Strong experience of software engineering practices such as Agile, Devops, CI and CD and others;
  • Strong experience with machine learning and scientific computing libraries such as scikit-learn, NumPy, SciPy, Weka, etc.
  • Knowledge of the machine learning life cycle;
  • Good knowledge of DevOps modern tools such as Docker, OpenShift, Kubernetes, ELK, Jenkins;
  • Knowledge of a deep learning framework such as Tensorflow, Caffe2, PyTorch or other.
  • Knowledge of the Actor model and asynchronous communication Akka., Kafka, RabbitMQ, etc.
  • A developer passionate about artificial intelligence, able to interact with software engineers, data scientists and R&D teams
  • An agent of change
  • Adept at translating a business problem into a technology solution
  • Comfortable working in complex environments that are constantly evolving and multidisciplinary team
  • [Bilingual (French and English)]

What we offer

Working here means you\'ll be empowered to be and do your best every day. Here is some of what you can expect as a temporary member of our team:

  • Inspiring leaders and colleagues who will lift you up and help you grow

  • Access to tools and resources to support physical and mental health, embracing change and connecting with colleagues

  • A dynamic workplace learning ecosystem complete with learning journeys, interactive online content, and inspiring programs

  • Inclusive employee-led networks to educate, inspire, amplify voices, build relationships and provide development opportunities

  • A Community Impact program, because what you care about is a part of what makes you different. And how you contribute to your community should be just as unique.

We are an equal opportunity employer

At Intact, we value diversity and strive to create an inclusive, accessible workplace where all individuals feel valued, respected, and heard.

If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please let us know when we reach out about a job opportunity. We’ll work with you to meet your needs.

Click here to review other important information about the hiring process, including background checks, internal candidates, and eligibility to work in Canada.

If you are an employee of Intact, belairdirect, or Johnson Insurance, please apply for this role on Contact People.

item.title: AI Developer Intern/Co-op – Hong Kong – Intact Lab
item.description:
Calling all AI and machine learning experts!  We have a fantastic opportunity to join our team in Hong Kong.

Artificial intelligence is shaping the future of insurance. Our latest lab is located in the Hong Kong Science and Technology Park to turn this vision into a reality. As Canada\'s largest home, auto and business insurer, we\'re here to cultivate the next generation of technology and talent. Together, we\'re helping our customers protect what matters to them most through the power of data science, machine learning and AI.

Life in the Lab

Technology is only as good as the people behind it. Every day at work, you’ll inspire and be inspired by the brilliant minds of our greater lab team: actuaries, data scientists, machine learning experts, geomathematicians, meteorologists, software engineers and designers.

Together, you will tackle challenging problems and have the freedom to imagine, research, create, test, and bring innovative solutions to life that will have a profound impact on our business and the needs of our customers.

As our company grows, your career will grow with it.  There will always be an opportunity for you to develop your leadership skills, strengthen your expertise or take your work in a new direction.  Whether it’s leading a new, exciting project or moving into a different A.I. product team in Canada or Hong Kong, your career will always be on the move.

As Canada\'s largest home, auto and business insurer, we\'re here to cultivate the next generation of technology and talent. Technology is only as good as the people behind it. Every day at work, you’ll inspire and be inspired by the brilliant minds of our greater lab team: actuaries, data scientists, machine learning experts, geomathematicians, meteorologists, software engineers and designers.

Together, you will tackle challenging problems and have the freedom to imagine, research, create, test, and bring innovative solutions to life that will have a profound impact on our business and the needs of our customers.

As our company grows, your career will grow with it.  There will always be an opportunity for you to develop your leadership skills, strengthen your expertise or take your work in a new direction.  Whether it’s leading a new, exciting project or moving into a different A.I. product team in Canada or Hong Kong, your career will always be on the move.

We have several fantastic opportunities for AI Developer Interns/Co-ops to join our teams. We are looking for students who can commit to a minimum of 3 months starting July 2023 or September 2023 . We also offer 6-12 months placements/co-ops opportunities.

As a tech pioneer within a new AI lab, you’ll have the opportunity to:

  • Work with data scientist to build machine learning and advanced statistics into software applications for real-life customer and business problems

  • Navigate differing opinions, ambiguity, and requirements to build and advocate designs with clear objectives and trade-offs

  • Explore new technologies to improve developer experience and engineering process

  • Grow alongside a diverse team of world-class experts in data science, software engineering, actuarial science, business, and design

  • Create, test, and deploy well-designed and efficient code

  • Collaborate with our teams in HK & Canada to share knowledge, learnings, results, and tools

  • All this plus great work-life balance!

AI Developer Intern: Here’s what you bring to the table:

  • Currently enrolled in a post-secondary degree in computer science, software engineering, AI or a related discipline

  • Experience with Python or other language such as Java, C++, C#, etc

  • Familiar with our tech stack: Flask, MongoDB, Kafka, AWS Cloud, Terraform, Vue.js, Snowflake

  • Unlimited curiosity and a passion to challenge the status quo

  • Ability to focus on vaguely defined issues requiring the application of a creative approach

  • Strong communication, time management and work organization skills

  • If you don’t have experience in AI, a strong desire to immerse yourself in this exciting field

About Us

The Intact Lab – with headquarters in Montreal, Canada – is a fast-growing, digital innovation hub backed by Intact Financial Corporation (TSX: IFC, HK$110 billion in market cap), Canada’s largest home, auto and business insurance company. 

Intact Financial (HK) limited (Intact Lab, HK) is our first R&D A.I. centre outside of Canada. This expansion into the Asia Pacific region is an exciting chapter of our journey to become the best insurance A.I. shop in the world.

What we offer

Working here means you\'ll be empowered to be and do your best every day. Here is some of what you can expect as a permanent member of our team:

  • A financial rewards program that recognizes your success

  • A dynamic workplace learning ecosystem complete with learning journeys, interactive online content, and inspiring programs

  • An extensive flex pension and benefits package, with access to virtual healthcare

  • Flexible work arrangements

  • An annual wellness account that promotes an active and healthy lifestyle

  • Access to tools and resources to support physical and mental health, embracing change and connecting with colleagues

  • Inspiring leaders and colleagues who will lift you up and help you grow

  • A Community Impact program, because what you care about is a part of what makes you different. And how you contribute to your community should be just as unique

#LI-Hybrid, #LI-IT

  • Inspiring leaders and colleagues who will lift you up and help you grow
  • A Community Impact program, because what you care about is a part of what makes you different. And how you contribute to your community should be just as unique

We are an equal opportunity employer

At Intact, we value diversity and strive to create an inclusive, accessible workplace where all individuals feel valued, respected, and heard.

item.title: Data Scientist Intern/Co-op – Hong Kong – Intact Lab
item.description:
Calling all AI and machine learning experts!  We have a fantastic opportunity to join our team in Hong Kong.

Artificial intelligence is shaping the future of insurance. Our latest lab is located in the Hong Kong Science and Technology Park to turn this vision into a reality. As Canada\'s largest home, auto and business insurer, we\'re here to cultivate the next generation of technology and talent. Together, we\'re helping our customers protect what matters to them most through the power of data science, machine learning and AI.

Life in the Lab

Technology is only as good as the people behind it. Every day at work, you’ll inspire and be inspired by the brilliant minds of our greater lab team: actuaries, data scientists, machine learning experts, geomathematicians, meteorologists, software engineers and designers.

Together, you will tackle challenging problems and have the freedom to imagine, research, create, test, and bring innovative solutions to life that will have a profound impact on our business and the needs of our customers.

As our company grows, your career will grow with it.  There will always be an opportunity for you to develop your leadership skills, strengthen your expertise or take your work in a new direction.  Whether it’s leading a new, exciting project or moving into a different A.I. product team in Canada or Hong Kong, your career will always be on the move.

Calling all students interested in AI and machine learning! We have several fantastic opportunities for Data Scientist Interns/Co-ops to join our team. We are looking for students who can commit to a minimum of 3 months starting July 2023 or September 2023. We also offer 6-12 months placements/co-ops opportunities. 

Artificial intelligence is shaping the future of insurance. Our latest lab is located in the Hong Kong Science and Technology Park to turn this vision into a reality. As Canada\'s largest home, auto and business insurer, we\'re here to cultivate the next generation of technology and talent. Together, we\'re helping our customers protect what matters to them most through the power of data science, machine learning and AI. 

As a tech pioneer within a new AI lab, you’ll have the opportunity to:  

  • Use machine learning and advanced statistics to help build innovative solutions for real-life customer and business problems 

  • Explore new technologies to use in your own solutions 

  • Grow alongside a diverse team of world-class experts in data science, software engineering, actuarial science, business, and design 

  • Transform data into meaningful conclusions and recommendations 

  • Validate the scientific methodology and project outputs of the other team members 

  • Collaborate with our teams in HK & Canada to share knowledge, learnings, results, and tools  

  • All this plus great work-life balance! 

 

Here’s what you bring to the table: 

  • Currently enrolled in a post-secondary degree in a quantitative discipline such as mathematics, science, engineering, statistics, AI, computer science or a related field.  

  • Relevant experience in predictive modelling, machine learning and advanced statistics solving business problems is an asset 

  • Knowledge of the underlying theory and implementation details of machine learning techniques such as clustering, decision trees, neural networks, Linear and Non-Linear Programming, Deep Learning (ANN, RNN, CNN) and Reinforcement Learning 

  • Experience with our tech stack is an asset: scikit-learn, xgboost, pytorch, tensorflow, LightGBM, pandas, numpy 

  • Programming experience in languages such as Python or R  

  • Unlimited curiosity and a passion to challenge the status quo 

  • Ability to focus on vaguely defined issues requiring the application of a creative approach 

  • Excellent communication, organization and a collaborative attitude 

 

Life in the Lab  

Technology is only as good as the people behind it. Every day at work, you’ll inspire and be inspired by the brilliant minds of our greater lab team: actuaries, data scientists, machine learning experts, geomathematicians, meteorologists, software engineers and designers.  

As our company grows, your career will grow with it.  There will always be an opportunity for you to develop your leadership skills, strengthen your expertise or take your work in a new direction.  Whether it’s moving into a new, exciting project or taking a leadership role in either managerial or technical path, your career will always be on the move.

Intact Financial (HK) limited (Intact Lab, HK) is our first R&D A.I. centre outside of Canada. This expansion into the Asia Pacific region is an exciting chapter of our journey to become the best insurance A.I. shop in the world.

item.title: Technical Program Manager, Environmental Management Systems, Data Centers
item.description:
2023-04-26T16:01:02.667Z

Technical Program Manager, Environmental Management Systems, Data Centers

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Atlanta, GA, USA
  • + 13 more locations
Apply

Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Atlanta, GA, USA; Council Bluffs, IA, USA; Clarksville, TN, USA; New Albany, IN, USA; Midlothian, TX, USA; The Dalles, OR, USA; Reston, VA, USA; Lenoir, NC, USA; Moncks Corner, SC, USA; New York, NY, USA; Reno, NV, USA; Sunnyvale, CA, USA; Bridgeport, AL, USA; Toronto, ON, Canada.

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree in Environmental Engineering, Environmental Sciences, Geology, Biology, Meteorology, related field, or equivalent practical experience
  • 10 years of experience in designing and implementing environmental management systems in the tech sector
  • 5 years of experience in program management
  • Experience in environmental regulations, environmental incident management, remedial investigations, feasibility studies, and risk assessments

    Preferred qualifications:

    • Experience managing vendors and contractors
    • Experience with project management tools
    • Experience and/or knowledge of data centers operations, development, and construction
    • Outstanding collaboration with cross-functional teams, analytical, problem-solving, verbal, and written communication skills

    About the job

    Google Data Centers (GDC) makes up one of the largest and most powerful computing infrastructures on the planet. The Environmental, Health and Safety (EHS) program enables compliance and safety excellence in design, construction, commissioning, deployment, and operations of Google owned and third-party data centers at scale.

    As a member of the Compliance, Safety, and Risk Management (CSRM) Environmental team, you will be responsible for developing and implementing an environmental management systems framework across our GDC teams. In this role, you will play a critical part in working collaboratively with a cross-functional team to identify programmatic gaps, develop and execute environmental campaigns, programs, and procedures to protect Google’s interests. You will also provide program leadership and oversight to new and critical environmental initiatives to continue to create and iterate our EHS program.

    For United States applicants: The US base salary range for this full-time position is $157,000-$235,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

    Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google.

    Responsibilities

    • Establish, implement, and maintain a conforming environmental management system, including environmental procedures and associated knowledge database encompassing all operating models of Google data centers.
    • Identify and evaluate data center environmental risks for end-to-end business impact. Design/lead programs to mitigate those risks.
    • Assess potential environmental liability risks with a focus on air emissions, soil and groundwater remediation, hazardous waste, water and wastewater, noise, permitting and compliance, incident management, cultural and archaeological resources, environmental, and human health risk assessment.
    • Drive continuous improvement, develop environmental key performance indicators, and track regional/global milestones and deliverables for our environmental program to ensure alignment with google data centers global strategy.
    • Investigate and analyze environmental incident reports and recommend global measures/programs to prevent recurrence. Establish internal communication channels through periodic environmental newsletters and campaigns.

    Information collected and processed as part of your Google Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to Google\'s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

    Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google\'s EEO Policy and Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

    To all recruitment agencies: Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other organization location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

    At Google, we’re committed to building a workforce that is more representative of the users we serve and creating a culture where everyone feels like they belong. To learn more about our diversity, equity, inclusion commitments and how we’re building belonging, please visit our Belonging page for more information.

    We welcome and encourage people who are expecting and/or parents-to-be to apply to this or any other role at Google.

    Google is a global company and, in order to facilitate efficient collaboration and communication globally, English proficiency is a requirement for all roles.

item.title: Business Intelligence Sales Specialist, Google Cloud
item.description:
2023-04-20T22:01:00.183Z

Business Intelligence Sales Specialist, Google Cloud

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Chicago, IL, USA
  • + 3 more locations
Apply

Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Chicago, IL, USA; Austin, TX, USA; Toronto, ON, Canada; Montreal, QC, Canada.

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • 7 years of experience selling Business Intelligence (BI) offerings.
  • Experience planning, pitching, and executing a territory sales strategy.
  • Experience prospecting for, proposing, and closing solutions in a specialist capacity.
  • Experience working with sales developers and customer’s technical leads to build business cases for transformation and the plan for implementation.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience at engaging and collaborating with executive stakeholders as a business advisor and thought leader in BI.
  • Experience executing commercial and legal agreements with procurement, legal, and business teams.
  • Experience and understanding of the Data Analytics (DA) technology stack.
  • Familiarity with Google Cloud DA offerings, especially BigQuery.
  • Excellent business judgment and analytics skills, using data to inform decisions and stakeholders.
  • Comfortable presenting to executives or C-level executives with a customer.

About the job

The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what\'s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

As a Business Intelligence Sales Specialist, you will be responsible for growing our Business Intelligence business by building and expanding relationships with customers. In this role, you will build relationships with both Cloud Data Analytics Sales Specialists (DASS), Field Sales Representatives (FSRs), Customer Developers, and customers. You will develop relationships with external customer stakeholders, identifying innovative ways to multiply your impact and the impact of the team as a whole. You\'ll partner with internal the Google Cloud Product (GCP) sales teams to grow their Business Intelligence (BI) businesses and lead overall value for GCP.

Looker is a unified platform that powers data experiences and delivers actionable business insights to employees at the point of decision. Looker integrates data into the daily workflows of users to allow organizations to extract value from data at web-scale.

For United States applicants: The US base salary range for this full-time position is $106,000-$163,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google.

Responsibilities

  • Own your number, calibrate the business against the Objectives and Key Results, and accurately forecast and report the state of the business for your territory.
  • Build executive relationships with customers as the Business Intelligence Subject Matter Expert, lead strategic direction for your customers as well as the Google Cloud Data Analytics Sales Specialists, Field Sales Representatives, and Customer Developers.
  • Develop and execute account plans, including a broader enterprise plan across verticals.
  • Assist customers in identifying use cases suitable for Google Cloud Business Intelligence solutions, and articulate solution differentiators and the measurable business impact.
  • Work with Google Account and technical teams to develop a pipeline and provide expertise. Execute sales plans and related efforts with the Cloud teams and Partners. 

Information collected and processed as part of your Google Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to Google\'s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google\'s EEO Policy and Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

  • Bachelor\'s degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
  • 6 years of experience in virtualization or cloud native architectures in a customer-facing or support role.
  • Experience with traditional Big Data technologies, Analytic Warehousing technologies, data processing technologies, performance and scalability optimizations.
  • Experience delivering technical presentations and live demonstrations in an enterprise business environment.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with technical sales or professional consulting in the fields of cloud computing, data, information lifecycle management, and Big Data.
  • Experience with architecture design, implementing, tuning, schema design, and query optimization of scalable and distributed systems.
  • Experience with developing data warehousing, data lakes, batch/real-time event processing, streaming, data processing (ETL/ELT), data migrations, data visualization tools, and data governance on cloud native architectures.
  • Knowledge of cloud computing (e.g., infrastructure, storage, platforms, and data), cloud market, competitive dynamics, and customer buying behavior.

About the job

When leading companies choose Google Cloud it\'s a huge win for spreading the power of cloud computing globally. Once educational institutions, government agencies, and other businesses sign on to use Google Cloud products, you come in to facilitate making their work more productive, mobile, and collaborative. You listen and deliver what is most helpful for the customer. You assist fellow sales Googlers by problem-solving key technical issues for our customers. You liaise with the product marketing management and engineering teams to stay on top of industry trends and devise enhancements to Google Cloud products.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

  • Support local Sales teams in pursuit of key business opportunities, engaging customers to address aspects of the data lifecycle.
  • Identify business and technical requirements, conduct full technical discovery, and design client solutions to meet gathered requirements.
  • Lead technical projects, including activities such as technology advocacy, supporting bid responses, product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work, and the coordination of supporting technical resources.
  • Prepare and deliver product messaging to highlight the Google Cloud Platform value proposition, using techniques that include whiteboard and slide presentations, product demonstrations, white papers, and Request for Information (RFI) response documents.
  • Work with Google Cloud Platform products to demonstrate and prototype integrations in customer/partner environments. Travel as required for meetings, technical reviews, and onsite delivery activities.

Information collected and processed as part of your Google Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to Google\'s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

item.title: Principal Architect, Google Cloud
item.description:
2023-02-10T16:00:41.843Z

Principal Architect, Google Cloud

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree in Computer Science or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 10 years of experience as an Enterprise Architect in a cloud computing environment, or equivalent experience in a customer-facing role.
  • Experience in cloud computing (e.g., applications, infrastructure, storage, platforms, and data), as well as cloud market and competitive dynamics.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience in building, architecting, designing, and implementing highly distributed global cloud-based systems.
  • Experience working with market leading BI Front-end, Data Analytics Middleware, or Back-end Data Warehouse technologies.
  • Experience with enterprise technology buying and evaluation processes involving large-scale computing solutions.
  • Understanding of Cloud Data Analytics technology stack (e.g., Hadoop/Spark Data lakes, SQL Data Warehouses, Data Streaming, ETL and Data governance, Business Intelligence, Predictive Analytics, BigQuery, Looker, etc.).
  • Ability to quickly learn, understand, and work with new emerging technologies, methodologies, and solutions in the cloud/IT technology space.
  • Ability to influence audiences and identify expansion engagements within accounts.

About the job

The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what\'s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

As a Principal Architect, you will be part of the Customer developing organization for Google Cloud. You will lead cross-functional teams to help customers design, plan, implement, and govern enterprise cloud strategies.

In this role, you will be a hybrid technical and business advisor. You will direct the conversation and guide the execution of the Sales team by combining both technical strategy and business insight. You will closely partner with Value developing in order to articulate the true total value of each technical solution and the overall business partnership with Google Cloud. You will travel to customer sites, conferences, and other related events as required.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

  • Build a trusted advisory relationship with strategic  accounts and engage with Architects, VP developing, CTOs, and CIOs.
  • Provide domain expertise around public cloud and enterprise technology in the industry, and effectively promote Google Cloud with customers, at conferences, and online.
  • Make recommendations on the integration strategies, enterprise architectures, platforms, and application infrastructure required to successfully implement a complete solution, providing best practice advice to customers to optimize Google Cloud effectiveness.
  • Manage the holistic enterprise architecture relationship with customers by collaborating with specialists, product management, developing, etc. Identify customer priorities, technical objections, and design strategies encompassing the entire Google ecosystem to deliver business value and resolve blockers.

Information collected and processed as part of your Google Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to Google\'s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google\'s EEO Policy and Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

To all recruitment agencies: Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other organization location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

To learn more about our diversity, equity, inclusion commitments and how we’re building belonging, please visit our Belonging page for more information.

item.title: Analytical Lead, Large Customer Sales
item.description:
2023-04-03T10:30:53.747Z

Analytical Lead, Large Customer Sales

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 8 years of experience in media analytics, advertising sales, digital media and marketing, consulting, or financial analysis.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience using search engine marketing (e.g., Google Ads), website analytics platforms (e.g., Google Analytics and other measurement suite products), and brand analysis techniques (e.g., upper funnel analysis).
  • Experience using SQL to extract and manipulate data, or other programming or scripting languages (e.g., R, Python, C++, etc.).
  • Experience with marketing analytics, return on investment/financial modeling, and statistical analysis.
  • Experience with spreadsheet software and presentation applications.
  • Ability to analyze large datasets and translate them to actionable insights.

About the job

Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google\'s key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.

As an Analytical Lead, you will be a strategic analyst, advisor, and consultant, providing data supported insights to clients and agencies to help improve their business. You will also influence teammates and clients in how they think about measuring the value that they get from their marketing efforts.

Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We\'re uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google\'s broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.

Responsibilities

  • Build and own client relationships with media and analytic stakeholders. Influence investment and measurement decisions based on impact to client businesses and craft recommendations that lead to client action.
  • Lead the development and execution of client-specific measurement plans that define a roadmap to improving measurement maturity.
  • Quantify the impact of Google media on client business objectives using measurement methodologies like attribution, experiments, and marketing mix models.
  • Design and perform analyses that uncover growth opportunities for client business objectives and drive adoption of measurement and attribution solutions to better value Google and non-Google media.
  • Build ways to solve common client business needs and share best practices (e.g., analysis, tools, frameworks) and client successes across industries.

Information collected and processed as part of your Google Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to Google\'s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google\'s EEO Policy and Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. item.title: Cloud Customer Experience Lead, Google Cloud
item.description:
2023-04-26T19:31:05.883Z

Cloud Customer Experience Lead, Google Cloud

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 15 years of customer-facing experience, working with executives, and driving customer development programs.
  • Experience managing customer organizational structures, developing technology programs, defining milestones, success criteria, resource allocation, and on-time delivery.
  • Experience driving digital development using cloud-based solutions (IaaS/PaaS) and managing initiatives across engineering, sales, support, and services.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master\'s degree in a management, technical, or engineering field.
  • 20 years of experience working in a customer-facing role.
  • Experience leading large enterprise organizations through a people, process, and technology transformation of building and operating legacy, on-premise software to running full speed as a digital native in the public cloud.
  • Experience with data center migration strategies, collaborating with channel partners/systems integrators.
  • Knowledge of Google Cloud ecosystem.
  • Excellent communication, presentation, problem-solving, conflict resolution, and program management skills.

About the job

In this role, you will act as a trusted advisor to Google Cloud’s customers by enabling them to use Google’s Cloud products to achieve their business objectives. You will partner with customers to develop and execute success plans (e.g., organizational, programmatic, technical strategies) to meet their business objectives and stakeholder goals.


You will work with customers to remove organizational and technical barriers and identify opportunities to help customers expand their use of Google Cloud products. You will recommend best practices and organizational changes to accelerate their onboarding and migration plans. You will also act as a customer advocate for product features and requirements.You will lead the successful adoption of Google Cloud, guiding customers through the people, process, and technology facets of their cloud transformation journey. You will work across customer-facing teams to ensure that a customer’s experience on Google Cloud exceeds their expectations.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

  • Drive the successful adoption and on-boarding of Google Cloud at key organizations to help customers realize the business value of our partnership and offerings.
  • Create value for customers by partnering to define success and build a joint plan with identified objectives, stakeholders, milestones, risks, and metrics needed to achieve their goals.
  • Develop strategic relationships with key stakeholders to understand a customer’s business within their industry and develop strategic roadmaps.
  • Guide IT executives through the organizational changes needed to unlock the full value of the cloud, and help them staff, train, and align their team members and partners to deliver on their cloud transformation.
  • Partner with customer-facing account teams and executives to develop strategic and technical plans that help customers achieve their business objectives.

Information collected and processed as part of your Google Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to Google\'s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google\'s EEO Policy and Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. To learn more about our diversity, equity, inclusion commitments and how we’re building belonging, please visit our Belonging page for more information.

  • Create value for customers by partnering to define success and build a joint plan with identified objectives, stakeholders, milestones, risks, and metrics needed to achieve their goals.
  • Develop strategic relationships with key stakeholders to understand a customer’s business within their industry and develop strategic roadmaps.
  • Guide IT executives through the organizational changes needed to unlock the full value of the cloud, and help them staff, train, and align their team members and partners to deliver on their cloud transformation.
  • Partner with customer-facing account teams and executives to develop strategic and technical plans that help customers achieve their business objectives.

item.title: Principal Developer, Google Cloud
item.description:
2023-04-24T14:30:50.401Z

Principal Developer, Google Cloud

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
  • + 1 more location
Apply

Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Toronto, ON, Canada; Ottawa, ON, Canada.

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree in Computer Science, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 10 years of experience as an Enterprise Specialist in a cloud computing environment, or in a similar customer-facing role.
  • Experience in cloud computing (e.g., applications, infrastructure, storage, platforms, and data), including cloud market and engaged dynamics.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with structured Enterprise Developing practices, hybrid cloud deployments, and on-premise-to-cloud migration deployments and roadmaps.
  • Experience with enterprise technology buying and evaluation processes involving computing solutions.
  • Experience in building, developing, designing, and implementing distributed global cloud-based systems.
  • Ability to learn, understand, and work with emerging technologies, methodologies, and solutions in the cloud/IT technology space.
  • Ability to deliver results and work cross-functionally to position and orchestrate solutions consisting of multiple products.
  • Ability to engage audiences and identify expansion engagements within accounts.

About the job

The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what\'s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

In this role, you will lead cross-functional teams to help customers design, plan, implement, and govern enterprise cloud strategies. You will combine both technical goals and business insight. You will partner with the Value Developing team in order to articulate the total value of each technical solution and the overall business partnership with Google Cloud.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

  • Build an advisory relationship with strategic accounts and engage with Specialists, VP developing, Chief Information Officers (CIOs) and Chief Technology Officers (CTOs).
  • Provide domain expertise around public cloud and enterprise technology in the industry, and promote Google Cloud with customers, at conferences, and online.
  • Make recommendations on the integration strategies, enterprise developer, platforms, and application infrastructure required to implement a complete solution, providing advice to customers to optimize Google Cloud effectiveness.
  • Manage an enterprise developer relationship with customers by collaborating with Specialists, Product Management, Developing team etc.
  • Identify customer priorities, technical objections, and design strategies encompassing the entire Google ecosystem to deliver business value and resolve blockers.

Information collected and processed as part of your Google Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to Google\'s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. item.title: Manager, Mandiant, Google Cloud
item.description:
2023-04-11T14:31:06.332Z

Manager, Mandiant, Google Cloud

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Montreal, QC, Canada
  • + 3 more locations
  • Remote eligible
Apply

Note: Google’s hybrid workplace includes remote and in-office roles. By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following:

In-office locations: Montreal, QC, Canada; Ottawa, ON, Canada; Toronto, ON, Canada; Waterloo, ON, Canada.
Remote location(s): Quebec, CA; Ontario, CA.

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree in Computer Science, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 7 years of experience in information security.
  • 5 years of experience in leading or managing technical teams.
  • Ability to travel up to 20% of the time as required.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Certification in offensive security including OSCE, OSEP, OSEE, OSCP, or relevant SANS courses.
  • 5 years of experience in three or more of the following: project management, network penetration testing, mobile and/or web application assessments, social-engineering assessments, exploit development, or reverse engineering.
  • Experience in public speaking engagements.
  • Knowledge of Unix/Linux/Mac/Windows operating systems, including Bash and PowerShell.
  • Knowledge of tools used for wireless, web application, and network security testing.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to interact with clients and manage expectations at executive and board level.

About the job

As a successful Mandiant Proactive Manager, you should possess a deep understanding of both information security and computer science and have experience leading a team of highly technical security professionals. You should understand Application Security concepts such as performing covert operations against complex networks while remaining entirely undetected, advanced application manipulation, and basic programming concepts.

In this role, you will lead project managers for all offensive engagements. This includes scoping prospective engagements, managing team metrics, establishing quarterly goals team growth, conducting performance reviews and 1:1 meetings, scheduling resources for projects, and delivering executive out-briefs. You are vital to the project lifecycle and must be able to deliver successful projects with little to no oversight.

At Mandiant, you’ll be working with and managing some of the best experts in the industry and faced with complex problem-solving opportunities daily. We help our clients protect their most sensitive and valuable data through comprehensive and real-world assessments.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

  • Manage consulting engagements, with a focus on advanced Application Security assessments, Red team operations, and penetration tests. Provide both subject matter expertise and project management experience to serve as the point person for engagements.
  • Assist with scoping prospective engagements, participating in engagements from start through completion, and mentoring less experienced staff.
  • Identify, market, and develop new business opportunities.
  • Supervise staff, provide feedback and coaching, and build their technical and consulting skills.
  • Improve Mandiant’s business processes and methodologies.

Information collected and processed as part of your Google Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to Google\'s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google\'s EEO Policy and Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

To all recruitment agencies: Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other organization location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
